princeton_ansible.title: Add lib-orange-alma-qa1 to bibdata allow list
[LIBWWW] DataDog APM for the library website is not reporting

comments.body:
I believe this got broken during the php upgrade.  Although the package was installed for ddtrace it was not enabled in php.  So I had to reinstall it on each server using the following commands
```
wget https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-php/releases/download/0.44.1/datadog-php-tracer_0.44.1_amd64.deb
sudo dpkg -i datadog-php-tracer_0.44.1_amd64.deb
sudo service apache2 restart
```

This seems to work, except it only sends traces when apache is restarted

pulfalight.title: Ensure that content negotiation exposes XML encoded finding aids

comments.body: I'm assuming that there is no use case for cache expiry and refreshing the XML expression of the ArchivesSpace finding aid. Is this indeed the case?

I'm also generally curious regarding the `#destroy`/`#delete` hooks for the ActiveRecord models here. I do not suppose that there is any of ensuring that removing a `SolrDocument` from the index can provide some form of a `cascade` (perhaps this is a mechanism which is found in Spotlight as a sidecar), is there?

> I'm assuming that there is no use case for cache expiry and refreshing the XML expression of the ArchivesSpace finding aid. Is this indeed the case?

I don't think so. The indexing job skips the cache, so every time it's indexed it should re-cache the material.

> I'm also generally curious regarding the `#destroy`/`#delete` hooks for the ActiveRecord models here. I do not suppose that there is any of ensuring that removing a `SolrDocument` from the index can provide some form of a `cascade` (perhaps this is a mechanism which is found in Spotlight as a sidecar), is there?

There probably is, I'm just personally not really concerned about it. There's fewer than 3k EADs, and you can't get to the XML if there's no solr record.

vireo_transformation.title: Remove nested unzipped files from mock-download.tar.gz
Add a cover page to each approved thesis

comments.body:
Note from reading https://github.com/pulibrary/dspace-python/blob/main/thesiscentral-vireo/dataspace/python/enhanceAips.py: 
* We need to keep the original filename on the augmented PDF. For dataspace to ingest properly, `contents` needs to point to the correct file. The python script changes the original PDF to ORIG-{filename} and creates an augmented PDF with the original filename.
* The metadata_pu.xml will contain an element pdf.coverpage equal to SeniorThesisCoverPage, though this will probably be addressed when creating the pu metadata.
The certificate metadata is entered in the metadata_pu under 'certificate'. Expect multiple values, per #16.

The "Request Type" column in the restrictions spreadsheet is a red herring. Look only at the "Walk In Access" boolean and "Embargo Years" integer to determine whether to apply the appropriate metadata. Here's the inherited logic to generate `metadata_pu.xml`: ```python if (sub[self.embargo_idx] > 0): self._add_el(root, 'embargo.terms', "%d-07-01" % (self.classyear + sub[self.embargo_idx])) if (bool(sub[self.walkin_idx])): self._add_el(root, 'mudd.walkin', 'yes') ``` In other words, use `embargo.terms` to set the release date, and `mudd.walkin` to `yes` if the "Walk In Access" column says so. We also want to update the `dublin_core.xml`. From Monika's scripts: ```python def _adjust_dc_xml(self, root, sub): changed = False if (sub[self.walkin_idx]): if (root.find('dcvalue[@element="rights"]') is None): self._add_el(root, 'rights.accessRights', EnhanceAips.WALKIN_MSG) changed = True logging.debug(" _adjust_dc_xml: changed=%s" % unicode(changed)) return changed def _add_el(self, root, metadata, value): logging.debug("XML add_el %s=%s" % (metadata, unicode(value))) splits = metadata.split('.') attrs = { 'element' : splits[0]} if len(splits) > 1: attrs['qualifier'] = splits[1] ET.SubElement(root, 'dcvalue', attrib=attrs).text = unicode(value) ``` The `WALIN_MSG` is: ``` Walk-in Access. This thesis can only be viewed on computer terminals at the Mudd Manuscript Library. ```

Senior theses that have multiple authors are often in the stem fields. Multiple students would then submit the same thesis. So we need to collapse the rows (and submissions) while enhancing the metadata with multiple authors. Look for the "Multi Author" boolean in the Vireo excel export. Here is an example spreadsheet from 2020's Mechanical Engineering program: 
[ExcelExport.xlsx](https://github.com/pulibrary/vireo_transformation/files/6274463/ExcelExport.xlsx)

![Screen Shot 2021-04-07 at 4.48.39 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5e9efff74d7b4923426b5c0d/0de7eae9-a587-4391-9e7b-2292f8ed3099)

Reworked the google drawing (easier for me to use draw.io). New issues were created where necessary and existing issues were extended with notes from the historic python scripts.
